thread.title_full: Tax credits: Conservatives could suspend House of Lords if peers kill off cuts in vote ... - Worldnews.com

author: wn.com
title: Tax credits: Conservatives could suspend House of Lords if peers kill off cuts in vote ...
text: Angry Conservatives are threatening to take drastic action against the House of Lords if peers kill off George Osborne’s tax credits cuts in a vote expected in the upper chamber next week. A rarely-used ‘fatal motion’ could be tabled in the Lords by the end of this week, paving the way for a vote next Monday with the specific intention of preventing the Chancellor from putting his controversial £4bn proposals into law. Read more
